The purpose of this subtitle is to optimize Federal data center usage and efficiency.

term.#tail: means a closet, room, floor, or building for the storage, management, and dissemination of data and information, as defined by the

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: means any data center of a covered agency used or operated by a covered agency, by a contractor of a covered agency, or by another organization on behalf of a covered agency.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: refers to the activity level of a server relative to its maximum activity level, expressed as a percentage.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: means the ratio obtained by dividing the total amount of electricity and other power consumed in running a data center by the power consumed by the information and communications technology in the data center.

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in consultation with the chief information officers of covered agencies, shall develop and implement an initiative, to be known as the Federal Data Center Optimization Initiative, to optimize the usage and efficiency of Federal data centers by meeting the requirements of this Act and taking additional measures, as appropriate.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in consultation with the chief information officers of covered agencies, shall develop and submit to
a plan for implementation of the Initiative required by
by each covered agency. In developing the plan, the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Deficit Reduction for Infrastructure, Value, and Efficiency Now Act of 2014/s:203/ss:a

text.#text: Within 6 months after the date of the enactment of this Act, the
The plan shall include—

descriptions of how covered agencies will use reductions in floor space, energy use, infrastructure, equipment, applications, personnel, increases in multiorganizational use, and other appropriate methods to meet the requirements of the initiative; and
appropriate consideration of shifting federally owned data centers to commercially owned data centers.

header.#text: Performance requirements related to data center consolidation

text.#text: Each covered agency may use the following methods to achieve the maximum server utilization possible as determined by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: . If the agency fails to close such data centers, the agency shall provide a detailed explanation as to why this data center should remain in use as part of the submitted plan. The
shall include an assessment of the agency explanation in the annual report to

text.#text: The closing of existing data centers that lack adequate server utilization, as determined by the
The consolidation of services within existing data centers to increase server utilization rates.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in consultation with the chief information officers of covered agencies, determines necessary to optimize server utilization.

text.#text: Any other method that the
Each covered agency may use the following methods to achieve the maximum energy efficiency possible as determined by the
The use of the measurement of power usage effectiveness to calculate data center energy efficiency.
The use of power meters in data centers to frequently measure power consumption over time.
The establishment of power usage effectiveness goals for each data center.
The adoption of best practices for managing—
temperature and airflow in data centers; and
power supply efficiency.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in consultation with the Chief Information Officers of covered agencies, determines necessary to optimize data center energy efficiency.

header.#text: Cost savings related to data center optimization

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: . Covered agencies shall determine the net costs from data consolidation on an annual basis.

text.#text: Each covered agency shall track costs resulting from implementation of the Federal Data Center Optimization Initiative within the agency and submit a report on those costs annually to the

Covered agencies shall use the most cost-effective measures to implement the Federal Data Center Optimization Initiative.
Any savings resulting from implementation of the Federal Data Center Optimization Initiative within a covered agency shall be used for the following purposes:
To offset the costs of implementing the Initiative within the agency.
To further enhance information technology capabilities and services within the agency.

by at least 40 percent not later than September 30, 2018; and
by at least 80 percent not later than September 30, 2023.
